Is it possible to have a social sharing link for SnapChat? I got this question from a client and didn't know how to answer. Has anyone done something similar?
never heard of such a thing, you could list the Username of the snapchat account or maybe the snapcode thing(Snapchats version of QR Code)
is there a way to disable the stylesheet setup to load everywhere in website settings? I’m building a coded template and I don’t want it to load the stylesheet from the settings
Thank you!
in the DM with the template opened and without select any module, in the right sidebar you will find those options

you can disable there by default.
(or inside the content editor in the settings -> advanced options, but then you need to do each time you want to disable for each page so its better do it by default in the template)

^ This is correct, but there is no current way to mimic this in a purely coded file, if that’s what you’re asking <@U2PDTMH53>. That toggle controls the flag `enableDomainStylesheets`, which you could PUT to using the templates API ( <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/templates/put_templates_template_id> )

Aside from that, the only other workarounds would be to set the toggles ^ in the UI before cloning it to HTML, or using a HubL filter on `{{standard_header_includes}}`, but I wouldn’t recommend that approach.

<!here> Hello! I wanted to let you all know that we recently made changes to how we’re handling legacy modules in the new design manager. Now, you’ll be able to edit legacy modules without having to upgrade them to the new modules framework. We’ve also enhanced some of our HubL validation so you’ll see less errors preventing you from publishing. Check out this blog post for more info <https://designers.HubSpot.com/blog/now-live-edit-legacy-modules-in-the-new-design-manager-and-enhanced-hubl-validation>.
